translation: present active participle of olema (to be)
context: The word 'olev' in Estonian has multiple meanings: 1) As a present active participle of the verb 'olema' (to be), it can mean 'coming', 'approaching', or 'present' when describing something that is currently happening or about to happen. 2) It refers to something that exists or is in existence. 3) In grammar, it's used as an essive case form. The word can appear in different forms depending on grammatical context - singular/plural, nominative/genitive/etc.
